active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains the mechanics of a clickjacking attack using a simple HTML/CSS/JS demo (e.g., an invisible iframe overlaying a fake button). The partner tests it in their browser, asks clarifying questions, and verifies if mitigations like X-Frame-Options block it. Then switch roles.
active_learning.problem_solving: Provide students with a vulnerable web app (e.g., local setup via DVWA or an online sandbox like HackTheBox). Task: Design and execute a clickjacking PoC targeting a sensitive action (e.g., 'transfer funds' button), test mitigations by adding headers, and report findings with severity scoring. Real-world application: Simulate testing a banking site login form.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding
